It is only fitting that I get to return to my favorite genre with the incredibly well-written trilogy of 'The Strangers.' at IMDbProMore like this5.2The Strangers: Prey at Night6.6You're Next7.2The Descent6.6Hush6.4The Hills Have Eyes6.2Vacancy6.7Trick 'r Treat6.3Paranormal Activity6.2Jeepers Creepers6.6Drag Me to Hell6.8Sinister6.1Wrong TurnStorylineEditDid you knowEditTriviaThe film was shot entirely with hand-held cameras or steady cams. Every shot has some camera movement.GoofsAfter Kristen injures her ankle, she limps in the house, then walks perfectly. Immediately after, she limps again.QuotesKristen: Why are you doing this to us?Dollface: Because you were home.Alternate versionsThe unrated version is over two minutes longer than the theatrical version which includes one additional scene of Kristen, after being stabbed and left for dead, is crawling on the floor of the house to reach Mike's ringing cell phone, only to have it ring off before she can answer it. Then the Man in the Mask appears again, takes the phone away from her, and walks out the front door with it, leaving Kristen dying on the floor.ConnectionsFeatured in Siskel & Ebert & the Movies: Indiana Jones and the Kingdom of the Crystal Skull/Cleaner/Recount/War, Inc./The Children of Huang Shi (2008)SoundtracksSprout and The BeanWritten by Joanna NewsomPerformed by Joanna NewsomCourtesy of Drag City RecordsBy Arrangement with Bank Robber MusicUser reviews915ReviewReviewFeatured review7/10 'The Strangers' are a little TOO scary...We all know the plot: young couple, isolated vacation home, people in masks. Yet from the start of 'The Strangers' it's clear that this film is a different. In today's bloodthirsty society, horror films are often reduced to nothing more than gore-filled gross-out fests. While many young teens may rejoice at such films, many of us still long for original, suspenseful, and, yes, terrifying horror movies. 'The Strangers' came so close.There is plenty here to recommend: Director Bryan Bertino shows himself to be a patient and smart director. Rather than going for just cheap thrills, he wisely builds tension up to near-breaking point. The feeling of suspense and dread that covers the whole film is classic. Both Liv Tyler and Scott Speedman do well in their leading roles, and the strangers themselves are things of pure terror... yet that's where the film loses some of its commendation. The strangers at times seem that they can't possibly be human because they are made to be almost supernatural in their abilities. They appear and disappear seemingly at will and instantly- a power the young couple probably wished they had but don't because they are, after all, HUMANS. It's a simple mistake used to give the audience one of those cheap thrills that were otherwise so wisely avoided. What makes it sad is that in every other aspect, 'The Strangers' is chillingly realistic and terrifyingly possible. Every time those strangers come and go like ghosts of some kind, it makes the audience sit back once more and say, 'Ah, well, it's just a movie." That's too bad.Still, 'The Strangers' is much better than your average horror fare. It's at last a new movie that realizes what you don't show can be even more scary than what you do. Still, one hopes that Mr. Bertino can touch up the mistakes from this film and , and deliver a really great horror movie next time around. 7/10 stars! Jay Addisonhelpful•202144jaddison383Jul 23, 2008Top picksSign in to rate and Watchlist for personalized recommendationsSign inFAQ29How long is The Strangers?Powered by AlexaDollface would ask "if Tamara is home?" but what if one of the main characters names were Tamara then what would possibly happen? title: What is the order of the Strangers movies?
text:
Show Menu
By Alex Wiggan
Image: ©Lionsgate
Advertisements
Advertisements
Advertisements
__
The Strangers movies
Image: ©Universal Pictures
The Strangers (2008)
As noted above, the first entry in The Strangers movie series arrived in 2008. The film focused on James Hoyt and Kristen McKay, and their night of terror at the hands of masked strangers, Dollface, Man in the Mask, and Pin-Up Girl.
In the movie, James and Kristen arrive at their remote property late at night, after attending a friend’s wedding. There is tension between the couple, but nothing out of the ordinary.
Shortly after 4 am, there is a knock at the door. When James opens the door, a young blonde woman is standing outside.
The woman asks if her friend is at the house. When James tells the woman she is at the wrong house, she leaves.
A shortwhile later, three masked strangers arrive at the house. They break inside and take great pleasure in frightening, terrorising, and assaulting James and Kristen.
The Strangers: Prey at Night (2018)
Although The Strangers was a hit with audiences, and plans were quickly put in place for a sequel to begin filming soon after the release of the movie, the project took longer than expected. The follow-up went through a troubled development, and didn’t make its debut until 2018 – ten years after the release of the first instalment.
This delayed sequel was titled The Strangers: Prey at Night, and picked up the story in real-time, a decade after the events of its predecessor. In this instalment, Dollface, Man in the Mask, and Pin-Up Girl terrorise a family who are vacationing at a remote trailer park.
The Strangers: Chapter 1 (2024)
Following the release of The Strangers: Prey at Night, The Strangers movie series went on hiatus. When it was revived, a decision was made to push forward in a slightly new direction with not one, but three new movies!
The films would form a new trio of tales, that would act as a stand-alone trilogy to the previous instalments. The first of these films would be The Strangers: Chapter 1.
In this movie, young couple Maya and Ryan travel across country to start a new life together. Along the way, their car breaks down and this forces them to spend a night at an isolated Airbnb.
Shortly after arriving at the property, the couple are terrorised by three masked strangers.
The Strangers: Chapter 2 (2024)
Continuing the story established in The Strangers: Chapter 1, The Strangers: Chapter 2 explores the horrors enacted by the strangers.
The Strangers: Chapter 3 (2024)
Devised as the final entry in the trilogy, The Strangers: Chapter 3 is a direct sequel to Chapters 1 and 2, and concludes the story.
Image: ©Aviron Pictures/Vertigo Releasing
Advertisements
Please note: While The Strangers movies are all loosely connected, technically the films can be viewed as two entities:
The original collection
The trilogy

New York Comic Con
The Strangers is getting a trilogy of new movies from the director of Die Hard 2
The movies will start with a remake, then take the story further
By
The creepy home invasion horror movie The Strangers has become a bit of a cult classic since its release in 2008. While the series did garner a 2018 sequel, The Strangers: Prey By Night, it never quite spawned the franchise you might expect from a hit horror movie. But director Renny Harlin (Die Hard 2, Exorcist: The Beginning) and Lionsgate are here to fix that with a trilogy of new Strangers movies inspired by the originals.
Harlin provided new details on the trilogy of movies during a panel at New York Comic Con 2023 where he also showed fans some frightening early footage from the trio of movies.
While we don’t know the full story of the trilogy, Lionsgate does have a description for the first chapter:
Madelaine Petsch (TV’s Riverdale) stars as a young woman starting a new life with her fiancé. Suddenly, during a road trip stop in a remote vacation rental in the woods, they become the prey of a mysterious gang of masked strangers who attack without warning or reason.
It’s a premise that should be instantly recognizable to fans of the original movie or its sequel, but what’s even more interesting is how this movie was made.
Photo: John Armour/Lionsgate
